name: Fantasia
description:
'''Fantasia Monique Barrino-Taylor''' (born June 30, 1984), also known [[mononym|mononymously]] as '''Fantasia''', is an American singer and actress. She rose to prominence in 2004 with her performance of the ''[[Porgy and Bess]]'' standard "[[Summertime (George Gershwin song)|Summertime]]" during the [[American Idol season 3|third season]] of ''[[American Idol]]'', becoming that season's winner. Following her victory, Barrino became the second artist after [[Lauryn Hill]] to have their first commercial single debut atop the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] with her 2004 song, "[[I Believe (Fantasia song)|I Believe]]". It went on to become the best-selling single in the United States that year.

Barrino's debut album, ''[[Free Yourself (Fantasia album)|Free Yourself]]'' (2004), received [[Music recording sales certification|platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) and was nominated in three categories at the [[48th Annual Grammy Awards]]. Her [[Fantasia (Fantasia album)|eponymous second album]] (2006) spawned the single "[[When I See U]]", which peaked within the ''Billboard'' Hot 100's top 40. Her third and fourth albums, ''[[Back to Me (Fantasia album)|Back to Me]]'' (2010) and ''[[Side Effects of You]]'' (2013), both peaked at number two on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]].

Barrino released her [[New York Times Best Seller|New York Times best-selling]] autobiography ''[[Life Is Not a Fairy Tale]]'' (2005), which was adapted into a [[Life Is Not a Fairy Tale#Film|2006 television film]] starring her. She portrayed Celie Johnson in the [[Broadway (theatre)|Broadway]] musical ''[[The Color Purple (musical)|The Color Purple]]'' from 2007 to 2008, which earned her a [[Theatre World Award]] for Best Debut Performance. She reprised her role in the [[The Color Purple (2023 film)|2023 film adaptation]], for which she earned nominations for a [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actress â€“ Motion Picture Comedy or Musical|Golden Globe Award]] and [[BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Leading Role|BAFTA Award for Best Actress]] and won an [[NAACP Image Awards|NAACP Image Award]] for [[NAACP Image Award for Outstanding Actress in a Motion Picture|Outstanding Lead Actress in a Motion Picture]].

She has earned over a dozen top ten hits on the [[Adult R&B Airplay]] chart, with ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' ranking her among the top female artists of the 21st century. [[List of awards and nominations received by Fantasia Barrino|Her accolades]] include two [[Billboard Music Awards]] and a [[Grammy Award for Best Female R&B Vocal Performance]] for her single "[[Bittersweet (Fantasia song)|Bittersweet]]", along with a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]]. In 2024, [[Time (magazine)|''Time'']] named her one of the 100 most influential people.
